briefdescription.para: Creates new property page.

detaileddescription.para: Note that the first page is not created automatically.

parameterdescription.para: A label for the page. This may be shown as a toolbar tooltip etc.
Bitmap image for toolbar. If wxNullBitmap is used, then a built-in default image is used.
wxPropertyGridPage instance. Manager will take ownership of this object. NULL indicates that a default page instance should be created.

simplesect.para: Returns pointer to created property grid page.
If toolbar is used, it is highly recommended that the pages are added when the toolbar is not turned off using window style flag switching. Otherwise toolbar buttons might not be added properly.

briefdescription.para: Deletes all properties and all pages.
Deletes all properties on given page.
Forces updating the value of property from the editor control.

simplesect.para: Returns true if value was actually updated.

memberdef.argsstring: (wxWindow *parent, wxWindowID id=wxID_ANY, const wxPoint &pos=wxDefaultPosition, const wxSize &size=wxDefaultSize, long style=wxPGMAN_DEFAULT_STYLE, const wxString &name=wxPropertyGridManagerNameStr)
memberdef.name: Create

briefdescription.para: Two step creation.

detaileddescription.para: Whenever the control is created without any parameters, use Create to actually create it. Don't access the control's public methods before this is called.

briefdescription.para: Enables or disables (shows/hides) categories according to parameter enable.

simplesect.para: Calling his may not properly update toolbar buttons.

briefdescription.para: Selects page, scrolls and/or expands items to ensure that the given item is visible.

simplesect.para: Returns true if something was actually done.

briefdescription.para: Returns number of columns on given page.

detaileddescription.para: By the default, returns number of columns on current page.

briefdescription.para: Returns height of the description text box.
Returns pointer to the contained wxPropertyGrid.

detaileddescription.para: This does not change after wxPropertyGridManager has been created, so you can safely obtain pointer once and use it for the entire lifetime of the manager instance.

briefdescription.para: Similar to GetIterator, but instead returns wxPGVIterator instance, which can be useful for forward-iterating through arbitrary property containers.
Returns currently selected page.
Returns page object for given page index.
Returns page object for given page name.
Returns index for a page name.

detaileddescription.para: If no match is found, wxNOT_FOUND is returned.

briefdescription.para: Returns number of managed pages.
Returns name of given page.
Returns "root property" of the given page.

detaileddescription.para: It does not have name, etc. and it is not visible. It is only useful for accessing its children.

briefdescription.para: Returns index to currently selected page.
Alias for GetSelection().
Shortcut for GetGrid()->GetSelection().
Returns a pointer to the toolbar currently associated with the wxPropertyGridManager (if any).

memberdef.argsstring: (int index, const wxString &label, const wxBitmap &bmp=wxNullBitmap, wxPropertyGridPage *pageObj=NULL)
memberdef.name: InsertPage

briefdescription.para: Creates new property page.

detaileddescription.para: Note that the first page is not created automatically.

parameterdescription.para: Add to this position. -1 will add as the last item.
A label for the page. This may be shown as a toolbar tooltip etc.
Bitmap image for toolbar. If wxNullBitmap is used, then a built-in default image is used.
wxPropertyGridPage instance. Manager will take ownership of this object. If NULL, default page object is constructed.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if any property on any page has been modified by the user.
Returns true if updating is frozen (ie.

detaileddescription.para: Freeze() called but not yet Thaw() ).

briefdescription.para: Returns true if any property on given page has been modified by the user.
Returns true if property is selected.

detaileddescription.para: Since selection is page based, this function checks every page in the manager.

briefdescription.para: Removes a page.

simplesect.para: Returns false if it was not possible to remove page in question.

briefdescription.para: Select and displays a given page.

parameterdescription.para: Index of page being seleced. Can be -1 to select nothing.

briefdescription.para: Select and displays a given page (by label).
Select and displays a given page.
Select a property.
Sets number of columns on given page (default is current page).

simplesect.para: If you use header, then you should always use this member function to set the column count, instead of ones present in wxPropertyGrid or wxPropertyGridPage.

briefdescription.para: Sets a column title.

detaileddescription.para: Default title for column 0 is "Property", and "Value" for column 1.

simplesect.para: If header is not shown yet, then calling this member function will make it visible.

briefdescription.para: Sets label and text in description box.
Sets y coordinate of the description box splitter.
Moves splitter as left as possible, while still allowing all labels to be shown in full.

parameterdescription.para: If false, will still allow sub-properties (ie. properties which parent is not root or category) to be cropped.
If true, takes labels on all pages into account.

briefdescription.para: Moves splitter as left as possible on an individual page, while still allowing all labels to be shown in full.
Sets splitter position on individual page.

simplesect.para: If you use header, then you should always use this member function to set the splitter position, instead of ones present in wxPropertyGrid or wxPropertyGridPage.

briefdescription.para: Sets splitter position for all pages.

detaileddescription.para: Splitter position cannot exceed grid size, and therefore setting it during form creation may fail as initial grid size is often smaller than desired splitter position, especially when sizers are being used. If you use header, then you should always use this member function to set the splitter position, instead of ones present in wxPropertyGrid or wxPropertyGridPage.

briefdescription.para: Show or hide the property grid header control.

detaileddescription.para: It is hidden by the default.

simplesect.para: Grid may look better if you use wxPG_NO_INTERNAL_BORDER window style when showing a header.

briefdescription.para: Creates property grid for the manager.

detaileddescription.para: Reimplement in derived class to use subclassed wxPropertyGrid. However, if you do this then you must also use the two-step construction (ie. default constructor and Create() instead of constructor with arguments) when creating the manager.

briefdescription.para: wxPropertyGridManager is an efficient multi-page version of wxPropertyGrid, which can optionally have toolbar for mode and page selection, a help text box, and a header.

detaileddescription.para: wxPropertyGridManager inherits from wxPropertyGridInterface, and as such it has most property manipulation functions. However, only some of them affect properties on all pages (eg. GetPropertyByName() and ExpandAll()), while some (eg. Append()) only apply to the currently selected page.
To operate explicitly on properties on specific page, use wxPropertyGridManager::GetPage() to obtain pointer to page's wxPropertyGridPage object.
Visual methods, such as SetCellBackgroundColour() are only available in wxPropertyGrid. Use wxPropertyGridManager::GetGrid() to obtain pointer to it.
Non-virtual iterators will not work in wxPropertyGridManager. Instead, you must acquire the internal grid (GetGrid()) or wxPropertyGridPage object (GetPage()).
wxPropertyGridManager constructor has exact same format as wxPropertyGrid constructor, and basically accepts same extra window style flags (albeit also has some extra ones).
Here's some example code for creating and populating a wxPropertyGridManager:

sect1.title: Event Handling
sect1.para: See wxPropertyGrid Event Handling for more information.
